When I think CPT my brain immediately goes to a cadence my drill sergeants loved that was about "CPT Jack". So... You are Jack. Now that we have that very important information out of the way... Will you tell me where your model fits in the context of things? A +3 Kelvin bump and +2 Tint points won’t move the needle; that’s deep in rounding/noise territory. The tiny cooler shift I measured almost certainly comes from: 1. **Different JPEG resize/crop** (your second file is 4 px wider), so my sample window hit slightly more dark background = higher relative blue. 2. **Compression dithering**—Lightroom’s export can scatter channel values by ±1 level. Neither indicates Lightroom “failing”; t... User: I did not export, I took a screenshot Assistant: Got it—​a macOS (or Windows) screenshot grabs whatever the *display‑rendered* pixels look like at that moment, not the underlying file Lightroom is working with. That brings two quirks into play: 1. **Color‑management hop** – Lightroom renders through your monitor profile; the screenshot tool then tags the grab as sRGB (or sometimes leaves it untagged). That γ + gamut remap can nudge channel values by a couple of levels—even when sliders are untouched. 2. **Spatial shift** – Each screenshot...
